data.title: Reworked, New Property editor / Inspector
data.body:
The current property editor is using the tree node and than doing some hacky tricks to make it a column based property editor.

Since a property list is a key part of an editor it would be nice to have a coustom class for it which is easier to understand and more flexible.

I opened this issue to discuss how it should look like and plan its implementation.
I also heard reduz saying in the internals talk or on irc that this class needs some work.

data.title: Multiple viewports in 3D scene editor don't work
data.body:
I'm pretty sure this is a well known issue, but I couldn't find it here, so I will open a new one for it. Currently most of the options under "View" in the 3d scene window don't work properly. So there is no way to work in multiple viewports or change the display mode (normal, shadeless, wireframe, overdraw). Clicking on the "Settings" dialog even crashes Godot completely. 

Godot version:  Godot 3.0 (master build from Mar 26, 2017)
OS: Arch Linux (Kernel 4.10.6)
GPU: Intel HD4000 with  Mesa 17.0.2

steps to reproduce are clear from the text description, i think.

data.title: GI probes don't seem to have an effect
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Linux 4.10, godot d4740a98537b1e7dcb6fb48176abdebe27eee83c
GPUs tested: GeForce GTX 645 with nouveau driver and Intel Haswell GPU.
**Issue description:**
I placed a GI probe in the scene with two cubes imported from blender, set the material property "emission" up for one of the cubes and pressed the bake button. It doesn't appear to work.
Screenshot after baking: ![Screenshot](https://lut.im/itPzyRnmwv/P0vxggNrUccT3fkH.png)

**Steps to reproduce:**
Import any models, create a GI probe around them, make one have emission and bake.

**Link to minimal example project:**
https://my.mixtape.moe/ignmrd.zip

data.title: Right-clicking a button when another button is highlighted
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**  Ubuntu 16.04.2, Godot Engine v. 2.1.2.stable.official

**Issue description:**
If a button is highlighted and a different button is right-clicked, both buttons recieve the signal. This is not the case for left-clicks.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Open the Godot Engine, download, install and open YeOldeDM/Minesweeper from the asset lib, start the game, left-click a tile, move the blue frame to an unpressed tile and right-click a different unpressed tile. Both tiles receive the signal, as visible by the "F".

**Link to minimal example project:**
https://github.com/YeOldeDM/godot-minesweeper
https://godotengine.org/qa/13550/how-to-disable-button-highlighting

data.title: Mac Godot not working on monitor
data.body:
Mac OS Sierra | Godot V2.1.2 stable


*Issue
Upon opening godot for the first time, after creating a project, I was greeted with the weirdest screen possible. Upon further inspection, I realized that my godot screen was scaled up by about 4 times, so I was just seeing one of the corners, making this software unusable. All help would be vastly appreciated.


To reproduce,
Open Godot on a Macintosh laptop connected to an ASUS HDMI monitor.
Create a new project, and open it.

Here is what my screen looks like afterwards... 
![screen shot 2017-03-28 at 9 21 29 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/26757096/24437198/fa1220f2-13fc-11e7-88dc-410f321d6791.png)

data.title: WebGL 2 export per WebAssembly or asm.js
data.body:
Add HTML5 export back into the new export system, now with an option for either WebAssembly or asm.js.

Names for the WebAssembly templates are `webassembly_release.zip` and `webassembly_debug.zip`

data.title: [2.1] Scaling Issue on 96x96 display.
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Godot v2.1.2, on Fedora 25 Workstation.

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
Opening 'Godot v2.1.2' on Fedora 25 Workstation via a 96x96 display, leads to significant scaling issues; This seems to effect the version found on Steam, the akien/godot Copr Repo, & compiling from source.

![Project selector.](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/26415691/24433419/288121cc-13ee-11e7-85a9-12526e7211d7.png)
![Main screen.](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/26415691/24433422/307dc06a-13ee-11e7-99ec-831943baa4e3.png)

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Open Godot.

data.title: cannot compile godot using msvc
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
visual studio community 2015 - windows 10 - godot 3.0

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
compiling always terminated due to errors (compiling via mingw works fine though)

**Steps to reproduce:**
tried to use vs2015 x64 native tools command prompt and cross tools and both have failed

**Link to minimal example project:**
<!-- Optional but very welcome. You can drag and drop a zip archive to upload it. -->

data.title: 3.0 alpha. SurfaceTool.
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10 3.0 alpha

**Issue description:**
I create a generated mesh from SurfaceTool. And its not visible in Viewport, and no error message in console. Code added to MeshInstance. Here code.

	extends MeshInstance
	
	var m
	var s = SurfaceTool.new()
	var vert = [
	Vector3(-0.5,0.5,0),
	Vector3(0.5,0.5,0),
	Vector3(-0.5,-0.5,0),
	Vector3(0.5,-0.5,0)
	]
	
	func _ready():
		s.begin(4)
	
		s.add_vertex(vert[0])
		s.add_vertex(vert[1])
		s.add_vertex(vert[3])
	
		s.add_vertex(vert[1])
		s.add_vertex(vert[2])
		s.add_vertex(vert[3])
	
		s.index()
		s.generate_normals()
		
		m = s.commit()
		set_mesh(m)

And same with custom ConcavePolygonShape(collision shape). Code added to StaticBody. Here code.

	extends StaticBody
	
	var vert = [
	Vector3(-0.5,0.5,0),
	Vector3(0.5,0.5,0),
	Vector3(-0.5,-0.5,0),
	Vector3(0.5,-0.5,0)
	]
	
	func _ready():
		generateCollisionShape()
	
	func generateCollisionShape():
		var shape = ConcavePolygonShape.new()
		var tri_arr = [vert[0],vert[1],vert[2],vert[0],vert[3],vert[2]]
		shape.set_faces(tri_arr)
	
		add_shape(shape)

data.title: Opacity won't affect Polygon2D
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Ubuntu 16.04 - Godot 2.1.2

**Issue description:**
Opacity won't affect Polygon2D

**Steps to reproduce:**
create a Polygon2D node
draw a polygon
change the Opacity value
you can see polygon is still visible even if Opacity is set to 0

data.title: bbcode to support different sizes
data.body:
It would be real handy to have different font sizes supported in bbcode

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/BBCode
suggests the following syntax:

[style size="15px"]Large Text[/style]

data.title: [3.0] TextureButton and TextureRect have no way to set a maximum size
data.body:
In godot 2 I could somewhat set a maximum size in the TextureButton and TextureRect equivalents, this functionality looks to be lost in godot 3.0, My images are higher resolution than they need to be and so the TextureButton and TextureRect expands to be as big as my texture, instead of making my texture fit into the area I want.

I suspect the size of the canvas is being set to the texture size regardless of the size I am setting in the editor as I have tried a number of Stretch Modes, but all result in the same incorrect size.

data.title: [2.1] rigidbody gets stuck in between tiles when following a navigation2d path
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 8. Godot version 2.1.2

**Issue description:**
at random times, but at the same position, a rigidbody or kinematicbody will get stuck in between tiles when following a navigation2d path.
Attached a gif file presenting the error, and the project used for testing. Is not a collision problem, there are no collisions shapes on the tiles tested with.
![nav_error](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16140708/24397727/d3987694-13af-11e7-80f2-6a1607187c39.gif)
[test_prj.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/878061/test_prj.zip)





**Steps to reproduce:**
move the mouse on the region presented on the gif file. Seems the errors appears as a function of the distances it has to travel, or maybe it depends only on the starting point.. could not say for sure.

[Edit: attached the correct project]

**Link to minimal example project:**
<!-- Optional but very welcome. You can drag and drop a zip archive to upload it. -->

data.title: 3.0 Editor Settings - Scene Tree settings are missing option for different number separator for new nodes
data.body: Scene Tree editor settings miss option to change default separator for numbers used when duplicating nodes. It was present in 2.x.

data.title: 3.0 Poly Editor settings not in Editor settings category
data.body: In Editor settings Poly Editor is outside of Editor category :)

data.title: Bug: Undo don't work after click on "Clear" in Script
data.body:
Godot v2.1.2 stable, ubuntu 16.04 and windows 7, 64-bit

I clicked on "Clear" by mistake. Undo don't work, And all my codes cleared.

![undo dont work](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16509592/24389181/2a91d012-136f-11e7-92dd-4416620dbf64.png)

data.title: 8145 - Mouse Position is unknown until first mouse event on X11
data.body:
- update input->pos on EnterNotify
- call first-time events processing before main initialization

fixes #8145 Mouse Position is unknown until first mouse event

data.title: Allow remote debugging on disconnected Windows machines
data.body: Fixes issues #7544 and #8064

data.title: There is no way to hide the shape on a TouchScreenButton
data.body:
**Ubuntu 16.10 - Godot version: 2.1.3 rc1**

**Issue description:**
TouchScreenButton shape is a great feature, but is not possible to turn the shape visibility off without  hiding the button or removing the shape.
While seeing the shape is a good visual feedback for input design, it is also a problem for visual design, so a way to turn it visible/hidden will be nice to have.

**Steps to reproduce:**

- Add a TouchScreenButton.
- Create a Shape (like a CircleShape2D).
- There is no way to hide the shape.

data.title: TouchScreenButton shape changes are not (visually) updated in the scene editor.
data.body:
**Ubuntu 16.10 - Godot version: 2.1.3 rc1**


**Issue description:**
TouchScreenButton draws a shape when creating it but don't update the shape in the editor when changing values.
It does show the correct shape when running and updates the shape in the editor when changing the "shape centered" property
It should update the shape in the scene editor when the resource changes.

**Steps to reproduce:**
- Add a TouchScreenButton.
- Create a Shape (like a CircleShape2D).
- Edit the shape in the inspector, changes won't be reflected in the light blue shape.
- Run with visible collision shapes to see the correct shape.
- Toggle the shape centered property to see the correct shape in the scene editor.

data.title: Max height for sprite preview in Inspector
data.body:
As you can see in the image, Godot does not display Sprites with a big difference in width/height aspect ratio properly. At least very tall sprites messes up the inspector view. The image used here is 800x20 pixels. As you can see the Inspector is maxed out in size but the properties are not even visible below the preview. 

Solution: Make a max height for sprites displayed in the preview window.

![godottallimages](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/24936603/24355825/b87894ba-12f7-11e7-91cf-096c4cc62260.jpg)

Godot version 2.1.2

data.title: Visual helpers to see Camera2D limits
data.body:
I think a great improvement for Camera2Ds would be to have visual helpers in the editor's 2D view to see the limits.

Today (2.1), you have to move around your camera node to see where the limits are.
If you could  see the four corners of the limits rectangle in the 2D would be easier. And even better: if there were handles to change them directly in the 2D view!

data.title: Several enhancements for the tile map editor
data.body:
Allow sorting tile palette by name
Allow hiding tile ids in tile palette

In contrast to 2.1, for _master_ I've set the defaults to be sort by name and hide ids since I think those are the most user-friendly settings.

data.title: Several enhancements for the tile map editor (2.1)
data.body:
Allow sorting tile palette by name
Allow hiding tile ids in tile palette

The default is the same as if these had never been added.

data.title: C++: No way to sort with an external variable
Include uniform (Shift down) mode in only-one-Node2D dragging (2.1)
data.body:
I overlooked that in #8114.

Feel free to squash them if you see fit.

data.title: Include uniform (Shift down) mode in only-one-Node2D dragging
data.body:
I overlooked that in #8115.

Feel free to squash them if you see fit.

data.title: Fix AtlasTexture + Sprite3D using the wrong UVs (2.1)
data.body:
Changes get_rect_region to return UV instead of a pixel rect and computes the UV rect for atlas textures using the atlas size instead of texture size.  Fixes issue #6338.

Alternately, could add another virtual to Texture to return the size of the underlying texture and compute the correct UVs in _draw.

data.title: Project description and tag as project property
data.body:
If the project have an option like tag and description, apart from the name, it could help to make a better project manager and use external tools for other type of project management.

Also if using versioning tools, will be possible to have different description and/or tags for each branch.

I'm not talking about a readme but something short, more like the asset lib project descriptions (but shorter) and categories.

ps: I don't know if this issue exists because is really hard to find something with "project" and "description" :sweat_smile:
